Patch Set 15: Commit message was updated.

This is good.

Why do we fail in the first place? In which line do we return 400?
Answered in the commit message.  Done.
May I ask the reason of not resetting query.top to std::nullopt here? I'm not familar with delegation.

you’re actually right, this is a mistake, it should be std::nullopt 

ACK
Yeah.... I was a little surprised this worked (usually something goes wrong) but not this time.

Maybe using `size_t top = delegatedQuery.top.value_or(query_param::maxEntriesPerPage)` would be better. This brings less change to current code.

As you requested to move maxEntriesPerPage to Query struct. I think we can have `defaultTop` and `defaultSkip` there instead of hardcoding it here.
Good idea.  Changes made in latest patchset.

Because in the first patch we were modifying skip and top.  Now we're not, so this isn't needed.

Fixed in latest patchset.

Changing the data type causes type error on line 3421. size_t is implemetation-defined and can be u16, u32 or u64. Calling std::min on different underlying data type gives error. Casting size_t to a larger data type will not cause any issue I think.

Also, this function is not modifying the value of skip and top now, it would be better to keep the const here.

I have fixed the std::min issue by just doing casting.

I don't have strong preference for this const copy-by-value parameters.
need to apply the 72 rule here
Do we not want to check if top is <= maxEntriesPerPage?
No. Top can't be larger than maxEntriesPerPage. See the parser function |getTopParam|.

I thought usually we want to check against std::nullopt in bmcweb. I feel like I had a comment about that before. Same with query.skip/top below.

(I personally also prefer this)

std::optional overrides the boolean operator, so it's very clear what !optional means.

What needs to be explicitly checked are those that are implicitly converted to boolean.
yeah, I also prefer just using `!optional` directly. But I just remember that Ed wanted me to check against std::nullopt last time. Maybe things have changed since then.
No strong preference. I prefer keep what we have now
I think current code is better as other params which can co-exist with skip/top might be implemented later.
For next time, signed-off should include all authors. I.e. Since Nan uploaded a version, a signed off should also be present from Nan.
